etymology.description: semantic: 爿(爿) (pán, "half of a tree trunk") + phonetic: 寸(寸) (cùn) = something measured in leadership -> lead
etymology.interpretation: The character 將(將) (jiāng, "lead") combines 爿(爿) (pán, "half of a tree trunk"), suggesting a foundation or base, with 寸(寸) (cùn), indicating measurement or precision. This implies the careful guidance or leadership required to manage and direct.

examples.chinese: 他將带领队伍(他將帶領隊伍)，迈向胜利(邁向勝利)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiāng dài lǐng duì wǔ, mài xiàng shèng lì.
examples.english: He will lead the team towards victory.

examples.chinese: 他將引导学生(他將引導學生)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiāng yǐn dǎo xué shēng.
